Module Robotinterface
Package robotinterface

Class RobotController

java.lang.Object
robotinterface.RobotController
All Implemented Interfaces:
TriggerReceiver
public abstract class RobotController
extends java.lang.Object
implements TriggerReceiver
An abstract super class of a robot controller, i.e. a piece of software that acts inside a robot. The interface ensures, the code can only access well-defined entities, thus, the same software may run inside the simulator and inside the real Bugbot.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Field Details

    • VERSION

      public static final java.lang.String VERSION
      Version of the robot interface.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • instanceNumber

      public int instanceNumber
      For multiple robots: which robot instance is controlled by this robot controller.

    • triggerSystem

      public TriggerSystem triggerSystem
      The system that distributes triggers among different robot controllers. The controller developer usually does not need this reference.

    • commander

      public Commander commander
      An object that allows the user to send text commands to the robot controller. The runtime environment may not be able to support a console. If not, such an object is available, but there will never arrive any command.

    • debugOut

      public Out debugOut
      An object that allows the developer to print debug text output to a console. The runtime environment may not be able to support a console. If not, such an object is available, but all debug prints are ignored.

    • debugPainter3D

      public DebugPainter3D debugPainter3D
      An object that allows the developer to draw 3D debug output. Drawing facilities may not be available on all runtime platforms. If not, such an object is available, but all drawing commands are ignored.

    • manipulator

      public Manipulator manipulator
      The manipulator instance. With this, the developer can control the manipulator.

    • gripper

      public Gripper gripper
      The gripper instance. With this, the developer can control the gripper.

    • eval

      public Evaluator eval
      The evaluator instance. With this, the robot can compute symbolic expressions with environment file constants.

  • Constructor Details

    • RobotController

      public RobotController()
      The controller developer should not override the creator. Instead, initialization code should be shifted to init().

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns a name of this robot controller.
      Returns:
      name

    • getDescription

      public java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns a short description of this robot controller, e.g. about the author and configuration.
      Returns:
      (multiline) string description

    • requiresConfiguration

      public boolean requiresConfiguration()
      Indicates, whether the robot controller requires a configuration. If so, the developer has to override the configure() method.
      Returns:
      true if this controller requires a configuration

    • configure

      public void configure​(java.lang.String params) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Pass a configuration to the robot controller. This method is executed directly after instantiation and before calling the run() the first time. The controller has to memorize the configuration for further calls of run(). The configuration is a controller-dependent string, usually passed as command-line argument. The entire parsing has to be performed by the controller.
      Parameters:
      params - a configuration string in controller-dependent format
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either the controller does not accept a configuration or the string is malformed

    • setStateRun

      public final void setStateRun()
      The runtime environment starts the controller's activity. This method must not be called by the controller developer.

    • setStatePause

      public final void setStatePause()
      The runtime environment pauses the controller's activity. This method must not be called by the controller developer.

    • setStateStop

      public final void setStateStop()
      The runtime environment stops the controller's activity. This method must not be called by the controller developer.

    • init

      public abstract void init() throws java.lang.Exception
      A method developed by the controller developer that contains code that is executed once directly after instantiation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if something happens

    • run

      public abstract void run() throws java.lang.Exception
      A method developed by the controller developer that encapsulates the activity. The developer should not create an own thread as the runtime environment is responsible for that. This method should not terminate until the actual task (e.g. to move to a certain destination) is finished. In addition, the developer should terminate this method, if isRunning()==false. This means, a manual termination is signalled from outside (e.g. by the stop-button in the simulator).
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if something happens

    • pause

      public void pause() throws java.lang.Exception
      A method developed by the controller developer that pauses the activity. This method must return immediate. Pausing means: stop any motion, but keep all internal variables. As pausing sometimes is difficult to implement, the controller developer may decide not to implement this method. In this case, stop() is called instead.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if something happens

    • stop

      public abstract void stop() throws java.lang.Exception
      A method developed by the controller developer that stops the activity. This method must return immediate. Stopping means: stop any motion, and reset all internal variables.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if something happens

    • isRunning

      public final boolean isRunning()
      Is the activity running?
      Returns:
      true if running

    • isPaused

      public final boolean isPaused()
      Is the activity paused?
      Returns:
      true if paused

    • isStopped

      public final boolean isStopped()
      Is the activity stopped?
      Returns:
      true if stopped

    • sendTrigger

      public final void sendTrigger​(int instanceNumber, java.lang.String triggerString)
      Send a trigger to another robot controller or any trigger receiver.
      Parameters:
      instanceNumber - receiver robot controller number of instance number of the receiver
      triggerString - the event type – this is any string that only has a meaning for the respective receiver

    • receiveTrigger

      public void receiveTrigger​(java.lang.String triggerString)
      Description copied from interface: TriggerReceiver
      Receives a trigger. Here, the receiver can execute code to handle this event.
      Specified by:
      receiveTrigger in interface TriggerReceiver
      Parameters:
      triggerString - the event type – this is any string that only has a meaning for the respective receiver
